content: You lean back in your seat and sigh, listening to the constant hum of the plane and the gentle rumble underneath you as you gaze out the window. What to do now?

choiceLabel: Find out why the person sitting next to you is staring at you.
content: You turn your head and meet the other person's gaze. Said person's face blooms red as they turn and cough into their hand. "Apologies," they said. "It's just - aren't you Dr. Banks? The speaker at {ifStateCondition}?"
You fellow rider's eyes light up. "I thought so! I {ifStateCondition}!

choiceLabel: I'm afraid you have the wrong person.
content:
You manage a polite smile. "Sorry, you must have the wrong person.".

"Oh! I'm so sorry! I thought - never mind, I'll leave you alone then." Flushing and shifting uncomfortably in their seat, they turn to look out the window.
"Oh, of course! Sorry!" they say, somehow unfazed by the rudeness of the question. "I'm Daniel Schmit, nice to meet you! I {ifStateCondition}"

choiceLabel: You turn to talk to the person who's leaning very, very close to you.
content:
Your first instinct is to lean away from the long nose inching closer to the newspaper lying in your lap. "Um, " you say. Their head jerks up.

"Oh. Hey." They jab at the paper. "{ifStateCondition}. Funny, huh?"
